description: Least k such that (n+1)^k + n^k is a prime.
comments: Note: k must be of the form 2^m (see A058064 for the m values).Conjecture: For all pairs of relative prime numbers (x, y) there exists at least one number n=2^m and one prime number p such p=x^n+y^n. This sequence show one case of this conjecture where y=x+1. - _Tomas Xordan_, Jun 02 2007
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 14 2000
